Episodes.Title: How to Look at a Painting and discover a New World
Episodes.Plot: Justin Paton introduces us to his passion for painting, whetting our appetites for the exciting journey ahead.

Episodes.Title: How to Look at a Painting of the Body
Episodes.Plot: The nude in painting is irresistible, and through the ages artists have had a love affair with the body - so where is the nude in painting today?

Episodes.Title: How to Look at a Painting of a Place
Episodes.Plot: Justin opens our eyes to landscape painting. He shows us how contemporary artists see landscapes today and how landscape painting has undergone an extraordinary transformation.

Episodes.Title: How to Look at a Painting and Connect the Old and New
Episodes.Plot: In the world of painting modern artists are drawing inspiration from the old masters. In Venice, the birthplace of painting, Justin shows us new paintings give a new lease of life to old works.

Episodes.Title: How to Look at a Painting of a Face
Episodes.Plot: For centuries the only way to capture a face was to paint it. Nowadays every handheld device can do the same job. Justin asks the question: are painted portraits worth looking at in today?s world?

Episodes.Title: ...And Take a Leap of Faith
Episodes.Plot: What happened to religious art when it came down from the walls of churches and began a new life on gallery walls? We go in search of the answers.

Episodes.Title: ...Of Nothing
Episodes.Plot: Guiding us through the seemingly ?nothing? world of abstract art, Justin teaches us that paintings that look like nothing at all always have something to say.

Episodes.Title: ...That Wants to Change the World
Episodes.Plot: Artists, like many of us, are troubled by the issues of the world. Can painting, this seemingly silent medium, get to grips with the world outside and make a difference?

Episodes.Title: ...That Doesn't Look Like a Painting
Episodes.Plot: Justin blows a hole in the myth that paintings are canvases contained within a frame, hanging on walls. Painting has flopped right off the walls and begun to flirt with other art forms.

Episodes.Title: ...In a Museum
Episodes.Plot: For many, visiting galleries and museums can be daunting ? all that noise, all those visitors, not enough time. How do we find that intimate moment with a painting in a public space?

Episodes.Title: ...And Start a Collection
Episodes.Plot: Justin explores the world of the art dealer and the people who buy. How fat does your wallet need to be and is it ok to say “I’m just looking!”

Episodes.Title: ...On Your Own
Episodes.Plot: Artists paint to communicate a message. By looking and listening they make us think about the world around us in new ways.
